com.acrosure

Class Acrosure

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.acrosure.Acrosure

  • public class Acrosure
extends java.lang.Object
    Acrosure is the class that wraps the capabilities of Acrosure's web APIs. Each instance of the class holds a specific API token and the host's URL. It also holds a dedicated HTTP connection. Most of the time, you have no need to change the host's URL; by default it will point to https://api.acrosure.com/. There are two types of API tokens: public and secret tokens. Both can be used exchangeable in most circumstances. Except for the case where you want to confirm an application, in that case, secret tokens must be used.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Acrosure

        public Acrosure(java.lang.String token)
        Initiates an Acrosure client instance.
        Parameters:
        token - your API token, can be either public or secret one

      • Acrosure

        public Acrosure(java.lang.String token,
                java.lang.String host)
        Initiates an Acrosure client instance.
        Parameters:
        token - your API token, can be either public or secret one
        host - API host that all the requests will be delivered to. Most of the time, you have no need to change the host's URL; by default it will point to https://api.acrosure.com/.

      • verifySignature

        public boolean verifySignature(java.lang.String signature,
                               java.lang.String data)
                        throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Verifies received signature and data against the stored secret token
        Parameters:
        signature - received signature
        data - received data
        Returns:
        true if the signature matches the one derived from the data. Otherwise, false.
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - this shouldn't happen
